results.title: The Solar House:  a Lifestyle for the Future
results.creator_credit: Harrison Solar Houses and New South Wales Energy Authority
results.brief_description: Discusses the various ways a typical suburban house can be more energy efficient, including solar energy, solid concrete slabs and insulation.

results.title: A Feeling of self worth
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Vandalism Task Force and Robin Young
results.brief_description: A feeling of self worth describes the approach taken at Monterey and the positive impact this has had on the school. Present and former staff and the parents of former students talk about the school as it used to be and the improvements that have been made.

results.title: Frankston Motor Cycle Park
results.creator_credit: Robin Young and Victoria. Vandalism Task Force
results.brief_description:
Trailbike riding causes damage to the environment and violence and aggravation between riders and local residents. This video was made to give councils, police and motor-cycle clubs some starting points and pointers towards developing their own locally appropriate solution.
Made in conjunction with the Frankston Police Community Involvement Programme and Frankston TAFE.

results.title: The Ghost in the shed
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: A whimsical story of a polite but persistent ghost of a secretly buried murder victim. His attempts to draw attention to his remains mystify the family in the house. Based on the book by Marilynne K. Roach.

results.title: Advance Australia
results.creator_credit: Dept of the Interior and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An interpretation of the Australian way of life, set against a background showing phases of Australia’s land, cities, natural resources, primary and secondary industries, arts, sports, recreations, and potentialities. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: What's in a Name
results.brief_description: Brian Coyne, a lecturer from Swinburne College, Melbourne, presents an examination of the emergence of the New Right/ Conservatism in Western politics and society, particularly Australia.

results.title: Headstart for Omar
results.creator_credit: Myrtle Winter-Chaumeny, United Nations Television and United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East
results.brief_description: Omar was a boy when he fled with his parents from the family orange grove near Jaffa and joined 750,000 Palastinian Arab refugees streaming out of the new State of Israel. Ever since then Omar has waited and now lives in Qatar, where he works and bides his time. Like others of 1948, Omar waits for the world community to settle a long overdue account.

results.title: The People's land
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Donald Taylor and Strand Films
results.brief_description: In Britain the National Trust has acqired a number of estates and areas of land of historical interest: they include ancient castles, such as the 14th century Bodian castle, a Chiltern village, the famous valley of Dovedale, a number of prehistoric stone circles, 14,000 acres of Westmorland countryside and an extensive area of downland in Sussex. These estates and landmarks are held in public trust forever.
